greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array T(n,k) of the expected value of trace(O)^(2k), where O is an n X n orthogonal matrix randomly selected according to Haar measure, read by antidiagonals.
comment: The expected value of trace(O)^k, when k is an odd natural number, is zero.
The first 5 rows of this array are A000012, A001700, A099251, A246860, and A247304.
T(n,k) = A001147(k) when k <= n. When k > n, T(n,k) < A001147(k).
link: L. Pastur and V. Vasilchuk, On the moments of traces of matrices of classical groups, Commun. Math. Phys. 252:149-166, 2004.
MathOverflow, Moments of the trace of orthogonal matrices.
example: The upper-left corner of the array begins:
